perturbation.original_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc., dated as of December 31, 2019, is, and any amendments thereto (including amendments on Schedule 13D) signed by each of the undersigned shall be, filed on behalf of each of us pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of Rule 13d-1(k) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.changed_text: The undersigned hereby agree that the Schedule 13G/A with respect to the shares of Class A Common Stock, $0.001 par value per share, of The RMR Group Inc. is filed on behalf of each of us pursuant to and in accordance with the provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific date and reference to Rule 13d-1(k), the agreement loses its defined scope, creating ambiguity as to which filings are covered. Later references to 'the Schedule 13G/A' imply a specific document, but without a clear definition of what that specific document is. This is because the exact type of filing which is specified is no longer defined.

perturbation.original_text: January 22, 2020 (Date) ABP TRUST /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature) Adam D. Portnoy, President (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature)
perturbation.changed_text: ABP TRUST /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature) Adam D. Portnoy, President (Name/Title) ADAM D. PORTNOY /s/ Adam D. Portnoy (Signature)
perturbation.explanation: Omitting the date creates uncertainty about when the agreement came into effect. Subsequent clauses that refer to 'this agreement' lack a concrete starting point, making enforcement and interpretation difficult. The document still references signature, so the date of that signature, which has been eliminated, is important.
